name: Veyatie-Lochinver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for first time and were very impressed. Large comfortable room with beautiful sea and mountain view. Quality and choice of breakfast was excellent and attentive hosts made our stay really enjoyable
reviews.title: Excellent B&B in lovely setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent accommodation for any visit to the Lochinver area. The rooms are generously proportioned, with very spacious en suites and STUNNING showers - very welcome after a hard day climbing Suilven!! If you get the 'Suilven' room you also get an astonishing view over the harbour to the mountains behind.
reviews.title: Super B&B, Stunning Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor in the rooms is up to date and tasteful without being too trendy or brash and its location at the end of a winding lane means peace and quiet; though this does mean a good 20-25 minute walk down to the town for dinner (both the Bistro AND pub are very good, if a little pricey).
reviews.title: Relaxing Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Mel and Dawn provide a warm and friendly welcome, they know the area well and can advise you (and lend maps/books, thanks Mel!!). Breakfast is extensive, generous and tasty and served on lots of beautiful local pottery (painted by Dawn herself). Kai the dog tops up that warm welcome with a very waggy tail and a pair of ears that love to be scratched.
reviews.title: Fantastic venue, warm & friendly owners, great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: You will be more than happy with a visit to Veyatie.
reviews.title: unexpected gem up a winding, hidden single-lane track...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed a week, travelling daily using Veyatie as a based. Were made very welcome when arriving. Room was large, tastefully decorated, spotlessly clean, modern, recently fitted on suite, shower, very good. Very quite location & lovely views over Lochinver harbour. I am critical on my cooked breakfasts, but Mels breakfast was best I have had for a long while, while my wife coverted Dawns pottery placement settings, but they would not fit in our case. Highly recommended, you will not be dissapointed. Try the Bistro in Lochinver to eat, excellent food.
reviews.title: Excellent, cannot fault.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great B & B very homely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks to Mel and Dawn for their hospitality. You have a great B & B in a great location.
reviews.title: An excellent & friendly B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beds were the best we slept in and just what we needed after long flights and drives etc.
reviews.title: Home from home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was cooked to perfection - thanks Mel.
reviews.title: A very high class B&B with spacious rooms and lounge in a wonderful spot.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mel & Dawn are wonderful hosts. The food was lovely, comfortable bedroom - great bathroom - fantastic view to Suilven from our room, also called Suilven.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This lovely home has everything we could possibly have wished for - a beautiful view from the windows, a glass conservatory and a huge comfortable lounge for our use, BIG bedroom, large bathroom, wonderful shower, fluffy pillows, delightful hosts full of knowledge and warmth, a breakfast served on beautiful pottery designed and painted by the hostess, quiet at the end of a single track road, a welcoming dog, and even breakfast salmon served in the form of a rosette! Our hostess even hung our laundry on the line outside. How we wish all accommodations were so charming, and yet so modern, large, and comfortable.
reviews.title: Best place we stayed in Scotland!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't miss a visit to Highland Stoneware Pottery in Lochinver, where our hostess is an artist. If you are adventurous, drive the single-track road out to the lighthouse at Stoer Point - breathtaking scenery.
reviews.title: The cleanest and most comfortable b and b we've stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This accommodation was extremely comfortable, the large bedroom was bright and well equipped and had a lovely en suite, with a powerful shower and plenty of hot water! We were most impressed with the cleanliness of the whole place and all the furnishings seemed new and in very good condition.
reviews.title: Gorgeous views from room overlooking Suilven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dawn and Mel were very helpful in suggesting places to visit but they weren't overly intrusive.
reviews.title: Assynt: a warm welcome awaits!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Veyatie is a great B&B. Not cheap but worth every penny. Great room, comfortable bed excellent bathroom. The breakfast is very, very good. Lochinver is a nice place and there is plenty to see in the neighborhood.
reviews.title: A wonderful home in a beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights at Veyatie and would recommend it to anyone. Excellent facilities, beautiful en-suite room with lovely view. Calm , friendly service, generous breakfast from people who clearly love the area.
reviews.title: Excellent and luxurious B+B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is one of the best B&Bs we have stayed in. Warm welcome, luxurious accommodation and excellent breakfast. Suffering from a bad back, beds in accommodation can be a bit of a nightmare - no problem here - really comfortable and a refreshing night's sleep.
reviews.title: one of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We've stayed at Veyatie for some years now, based on an initial recommendation from locals. Surprised to see a recent review described it as "unscottish." Mel and Dawn truly understand what Scottish hospitality really means -fine welcome, good food, first class rooms, good price, nothing too much trouble! For anyone who has been before, the new rooms are spectacular!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Veyatie for one night. It's a modern house, the view wasa bit disappointing - on a mill at Lochinver. It is to far from Lochinver to walk. The road to Veyatie is very narrow and winding. The house and the owners were a bit un-scottish in our opinion. Modern and businesslike. The room was good and bright, a very goor bed and great shower, indeed. The best we had!!! Good breakfast.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, not very Scottish

description: Veyatie is a modern bungalow set in a very peaceful location at the end of Baddidarrach, overlooking the sea loch of Loch Inver. We are centrally located in the North West Highlands Geopark, one of the few Geoparks in Great Britain and have unparalleled backdrop of the mountains Quinag, Canisp and Suilven spread before us.
